subject: Gardening
title: Arts and Crafts Gardens
description: A quick win: understand Arts and Crafts Gardens.

hook.text: William Morris hated industrial ugliness. His design movement created gardens that felt handmade, personal.

buildup.text: Arts and Crafts gardens blended architecture with planting. Edwin Lutyens designed the structure.

discovery.text: The movement valued local materials, craftsmanship, and regional plants. Every garden was unique to its place and maker.

twist.text: Despite rejecting industry, Arts and Crafts gardens were costly. Only the wealthy could afford handmade everything.

punchline.text: The anti-industrial garden movement needed industrial wealth to exist.

quiz.question: What was the key contribution of the Lutyens-Jekyll partnership to garden design?
options: They invented the English landscape garden movement
They created the template for modern mixed borders integrating structure and planting
They designed the first public botanical gardens in England
